content.body:
> <@aclaymore:matrix.org> I presume the idea is that it could skip that? But then I think that means this is possible:
> 
> ```
> ref.is(obj); // true
> obj = null;
> ref.deref(); // undefined, we observed sync GC
> ```

it could add `obj` to kept objects i guess.
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @aclaymore:matrix.org
I presume the idea is that it could skip that? But then I think that means this is possible:

```
ref.is(obj); // true
obj = null;
ref.deref(); // undefined, we observed sync GC
```
it could add obj to kept objects i guess.

content.body: the goal is to avoid adding the other thing it holds
* the goal is to avoid adding whatever it contains if its not `obj`
content.formatted_body: * the goal is to avoid adding whatever it contains if its not obj

m.new_content.body: the goal is to avoid adding whatever it contains if its not `obj`
m.new_content.formatted_body: the goal is to avoid adding whatever it contains if its not obj
